intro: Synotis nagensium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved synotis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Synotis nagensium is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
